column4: hey guys. Is there any way to add like an application menu on ubuntu 12.04 unity?
theres several indicator-applets and i recall an app to put a classic gnome2 type menu at the top of the UNITY left side panel
theres a list of indicator-applets at askubuntu.com  and i recall the otehr  i found by searching for 'classic gnome menu unity' at webupd8 or omgubuntu, or askubuntu.com
thank you
theres like 5 differnt tools/ways
i always have to rember to sort by votes at askubuntu.com   http://askubuntu.com/questions/30334/what-application-indicators-are-available
I am trying your link right now.
i always check that listing to see what new neat things come out. ;)
are you on ubuntu 12.04
on 12.10 right now..  cardapio is an app that lets you have a 'menu' on a button on the left side panel..
how did you upgraded to quantun quetzal?
i dident.. i always do clean installs.
oh, so you installed it clean. Oh yeah is in beta 1. How is it working for you
no real issues.  has good days and bad. ;)
name turned red where?
on the terminal
where at on the terminal? You mean in the prompt?
like the letters of my user name. Am I wrong? Yes, after typing su and entering my password
one normally dosent use 'su'  except to switch to specific users.. so im stillnot sure where you mean.

sorry for confusing you. What i meant is when i access my terminal via [ctl -ALT-t] and su and my password, my user name root@cowsquad-A305-S6872:/home/cowsquad# used to turn red, like red letters. But it doesnt do that any more
bash prompt settings...  never noticed the color.
